so you need to go into the design manager in HubSpot (located under `marketing — files and templates — design tool` )and find that specific module.  you should be able to search by the name of the module.  once you find it, open it.
you will see three columns.  the far right column will have a section called fields.  you should see an option that says add fields
click on add field and you should see an field type called `boolean`.  Select that
you can rename the boolean to whatever you want.  such as “Hide Content”
then, when you are in that field, you should now see an option called `copy` click it and select `copy snippet`
toggle the option `check by default` .  this will make the default state true so it shows up on all of your other pages
now, go to the center column where the code is and paste the snippet you had previously copied
paste it at the top
what you want to do is cut the `{% endif %}` and paste it at the bottom of the the code.  so in the end you should have the if at the very top and the endif at the very bottom
what this is going to do is if you toggle the hide content field off, everything between those two lines will be ignored
this assumes that in your module, there is nothing else but the header content field.  if there are other things, send me a screenshot of the module and i will help you place it in the correct spot
